item.title: Russia-Ukraine talks: All the mediation efforts, and where they stand
item.content:encoded: Nearly four years into Russia's war on Ukraine, multiple peace efforts have been started, but no end is in sight.

item.title: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi reappointed as PM
item.content:encoded: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi was formally reappointed as prime minister by Emperor Naruhito.

item.title: Why is the US targeting Cuba’s global medical missions?
item.content:encoded: Amid Cuba’s deepening fuel crisis, countries are bowing to US pressure and winding down their Cuban medical programmes.

item.title: Mikaela Shiffrin wins slalom Olympic gold medal at Winter Games 2026
item.content:encoded: American ski great clinches her fourth career Olympic medal, and her first since 2018, in the women's slalom at Tofane.

item.title: Pro-Palestine activists acquitted of burglary at Israeli arms site in UK
item.content:encoded: Filton24 defendants, members of Palestine Action, found not guilty as prosecutors fail to provide evidence.

item.title: Facebook, TikTok suspended in Gabon under regulator’s order
item.content:encoded: Gabonese authorities impose indefinite social media blackout, citing risks to social cohesion and national stability.

item.title: Life on Hold: Stories of Displacement from the Ukraine War
item.content:encoded: What does it mean to put your life on hold when war forces you to leave home?

item.title: Israel kills two in Gaza, blocks thousands from medical exit through Rafah
item.content:encoded: The latest deaths come as just 260 people have been allowed to seek medical care via the crossing to Egypt, the UN says.

item.title: Farhan leads Pakistan into T20 World Cup Super Eights as Namibia crumble
item.content:encoded: Pakistan beat Namibia by 102 runs in Colombo as Sahibzada Farhan hits his first T20 international century.

item.title: Israeli minister wants to cancel ‘damned’ Oslo Accords
item.content:encoded: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said his Religious Zionist Party wants to ‘cancel the damned Oslo Accords’.

item.title: Calculated hypocrisy: Why Western powers court Beijing but rely on US
item.content:encoded: Economic engagement with China does not amount to strategic realignment.

item.title: Trump’s Board of Peace meets: Who’s in, who’s out, what’s on the agenda?
item.content:encoded: Asian and Middle Eastern partners line up in Washington, while Europe tries to keep a distance.

item.title: Vonn’s skis didn’t release in Olympic crash as safety concerns resurface
item.content:encoded: 'Smart binding' system in development, but costs are a concern as well as whether skiers really want it.

item.title: Tested on Palestinians: Epstein, Israel’s Barak pushed spy tech in Nigeria
item.content:encoded: Investigation reveals how Jeffrey Epstein and Ehud Barak marketed Israeli surveillance tech to profit from Nigeria.

item.title: Pakistan’s Punjab police kill 900 people in eight months: What’s going on?
item.content:encoded: Human rights report alleges record extrajudicial killings by Punjab’s police unit set up to combat organised crime.

item.title: Video: Sara Duterte announces run for presidency of Philippines
item.content:encoded: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte has announced she will run for president in 2028.

item.title: Bulgaria ⁠to hold snap parliamentary election on April 19 after protests
item.content:encoded: Eighth vote in just five years follows government resignation after weeks of protests over budget, alleged corruption.

item.title: Ramadan begins as impact of genocide is still felt in Gaza
item.content:encoded: Palestinians are marking the start of the holy month of Ramadan in Gaza where the impact of Israel’s war is still felt.

item.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes to compete under own flag at Paralympics 2026
item.content:encoded: Ukraine reacts angrily to the IPC's decision, saying the move was 'disappointing and outrageous'.

item.title: Indian university faces backlash for presenting Chinese robot as its own
item.content:encoded: Social media ​users identify the robot as the Unitree Go2, sold by China's Unitree Robotics.

item.title: Video: War crimes complaint against Israeli sniper filed in Chile
item.content:encoded: A criminal complaint filed to a Chile court seeks the prosecution of an Israeli Ukrainian ex-sniper who was in Gaza.

item.title: T20 World Cup: South Africa beat UAE before India showdown
item.content:encoded: South Africa continue their pursuit of a first ICC title as they beat UAE by six wickets at the 2026 T20 World Cup.

item.title: Syrian government closes al-Hol camp after chaos and unrest
item.content:encoded: Syria’s government has been relocating families after announcing the closure of the notorious al-Hol camp.

item.title: Real Madrid’s Vinicius Jr alleges racism as Mourinho and Benfica under fire
item.content:encoded: Former Real boss Jose Mourinho criticised for his response to alleged racism by his Benfica player towards Vinicius Jr.

item.title: Israeli army sniper in Chile accused of Gaza war crimes could face justice
item.content:encoded: Rom Kovtun's social media reveal he was holidaying in country, opening door to 'universal jurisdiction' legal jeopardy.
